text: Basehor is a city in Leavenworth County, Kansas, United States. It is a suburb of the Kansas City Metropolitan Area. In 2020, 6,896 people lived there. ==Geography== Basehor is at (39.135325, -94.929047). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 6,896 people, 2,531 households, and 1,968 families living in Basehor. Of the households, 82.1% owned their home and 17.9% rented their home. The median age was 39.1 years. Of the people, 87.7% were White, 2.4% were Black, 1.2% were Asian, 0.5% were Native American, 1.4% were from some other race, and 6.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 5.4% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 4,613 people, 1,751 households, and 1,337 families living in Basehor. ==Education== Basehor is served by USD 458 Basehor Linwood. The district high school is Basehor- Linwood High School located in Basehor. ==References== ==Other websites== * City of Basehor * Basehor â€“ Directory of Public Officials * Basehor City Map , KDOT Category:1889 establishments in the United States Category:Cities in Kansas
title: Basehor, Kansas
